sentences: Ambili  is an Indian film singer in Malayalam cinema during the 1970s and 1980s.
Padmaja Thampi, known as Ambili, was born as the youngest among five children to R C Thampi and Sukumari at Thiruvananthapuram.
Her debut song was "Karagre vasathe" from the movie Sabarimala Sree Dharmashaastha in 1970.
She currently resides at Chennai with family.
She is a recipient of Global NSS (Nair Service Society) award in 2017.
